text: Félix Mathé (1834-1911) was a French politician. ==Early life== Félix Mathé was born on 20 November 1834 in Moulins, Auvergne, rural France.National Assembly: Félix Mathé His father died when he was three years old, and he was adopted by his paternal uncle, Antoine Félix Mathé.Jean-Marie Mayeur (ed.), Les parlementaires de la Seine sous la Troisième République: Etudes, Paris: Publications de la Sorbonnes, 2001, Volume 1, pp. 411-412 He had a brother, Henri Mathé. ==Career== He served as a member of the Chamber of Deputies from 1883 to 1895. ==Death== He died on 27 August 1911 in Moulins, Auvergne. ==References== Category:1834 births Category:1911 deaths Category:People from Moulins, Allier Category:Politicians from Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Category:French republicans Category:Members of the 4th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:Members of the 5th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:Members of the 6th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic
title: Félix Mathé
